p: The paralysis caused to M. incognita and M. javanica J2s by the different concentrations of the EO is presented in Table 2 and Table 3, respectively. The essential oil paralyzed 100% of the J2s of both species after 96 h of immersion at the concentration of 62.5 μL/L. The same level of J2 paralysis remained as the concentration was increased to 500 μL/L. It is noticeable that low J2 paralysis was observed up to the concentration of 31.2 for both species after immersion times of 24 and 48 h, while the recorded paralysis was drastically increased as the concentration was increased to 62.5 μL/L ( Table 2 and Table 3). However high numbers of paralyzed M. incognita J2s were recorded at the dose of 31.2 μL/L for both experiments after 96 h of incubation ( Table 2).
